Class Game_Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game_Driver
  • class Game_Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    Receives required objects from Board and takes the user input and manipulates the objects as necessary to play Minesweeper.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static javax.swing.JFrame mGame
      set equal to JFrame board in constructor from Board, game window that user interacts with
      private static int mNumCols
      holds the number of columns
      private static int mNumMines
      holds the number of mines
      private static int mNumRows
      holds the number of rows
      private static Tile[][] mTileArray
      2D Tile array of used for game logic, equal coordinates to nXm game board
      private java.util.Random random
      creates a random value, used for x,y coordinates

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Game_Driver​(javax.swing.JFrame game, Tile[][] tileArray, int numRows, int numCols, int mineCount)
      This constructor is called in Board to initialize the board with the already checked input from the user.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      (package private) static void gameOver()
      Displays all of the bombs and disables all of the buttons, presents the user with a replay option.
      (package private) static void gameWin()
      Displays all of the bombs and disables all of the buttons, presents the user with a replay option.
      private void initBoard()
      calls placeMines() to randomly place mines throughout the board and then calls setRiskNum() to set the mine count of every tile.
      (package private) static boolean isEndPossible()
      Iterates through the board and checks every tile that is not a mine, if every tile that is not a mine is disabled as a result of being clicked, the game may end.
      (package private) static void openTile​(int i, int j)
      If a tile is blank, check that the orthogonally adjacent tiles are openable with canOpen(), if true recursively call openTile() until tiles that are unopenable are encountered.
      private void placeMines()
      calls setMine() the number of times equal to the number of mines
      private void setMine()
      sets a random x and y bound by the length of the rows and columns then checks if a mine is present, if a mine is present call setMine() again, eventually coming off the stack when all mines are placed.
      private void setRiskNum()
      checks the surrounding positions of a tile for a mine, if a mine is present increment mineRisk, once all if statements are checked called setSurroundingMines() and pass in mineRisk.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • mGame

        private static javax.swing.JFrame mGame
        set equal to JFrame board in constructor from Board, game window that user interacts with

      • mNumCols

        private static int mNumCols
        holds the number of columns

      • mNumMines

        private static int mNumMines
        holds the number of mines

      • mNumRows

        private static int mNumRows
        holds the number of rows

      • mTileArray

        private static Tile[][] mTileArray
        2D Tile array of used for game logic, equal coordinates to nXm game board

      • random

        private java.util.Random random
        creates a random value, used for x,y coordinates

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game_Driver

        Game_Driver​(javax.swing.JFrame game,
            Tile[][] tileArray,
            int numRows,
            int numCols,
            int mineCount)
        This constructor is called in Board to initialize the board with the already checked input from the user.
        Parameters:
        game - JFrame of the nXm board
        tileArray - Tile object array already associated with buttons
        numRows - value of amount of rows in the board
        numCols - value of amount of columns in the board
        mineCount - amount of mines user wants to place in their board
        See Also:
        initBoard()
        Pre-condition:
        passes in ready to go frame with buttons already associated to tileArray
        Post-condition:
        Game is fully initialized

    • Method Detail

      • gameOver

        static void gameOver()
        Displays all of the bombs and disables all of the buttons, presents the user with a replay option.
        See Also:
        gameWin()
        Pre-condition:
        User has lost, mine has been hit
        Post-condition:
        Game Board is disabled and lose frame pops up

      • gameWin

        static void gameWin()
        Displays all of the bombs and disables all of the buttons, presents the user with a replay option.
        See Also:
        gameOver()
        Pre-condition:
        User has won, all tiles revealed, flags are placed
        Post-condition:
        Win window is revealed

      • initBoard

        private void initBoard()
        calls placeMines() to randomly place mines throughout the board and then calls setRiskNum() to set the mine count of every tile.
        See Also:
        placeMines(), setRiskNum()
        Pre-condition:
        called in constructor after using parameters from Board
        Post-condition:
        game board is initialized through mTileArray

      • isEndPossible

        static boolean isEndPossible()
        Iterates through the board and checks every tile that is not a mine, if every tile that is not a mine is disabled as a result of being clicked, the game may end. Only called by setting a flag.
        Returns:
        boolean isPossible, depends on if any buttons are still enabled
        See Also:
        Tile.mouseListener
        Pre-condition:
        called in (@link #Tile} #mouselistener to see if one has won
        Post-condition:
        the boolean returned checked if the game has been won

      • openTile

        static void openTile​(int i,
                     int j)
        If a tile is blank, check that the orthogonally adjacent tiles are openable with canOpen(), if true recursively call openTile() until tiles that are unopenable are encountered.
        Parameters:
        i - coordinate to which tile needs to be opened
        j - coordinate to which tile needs to be opened
        See Also:
        Tile.setIsOpened(), Tile.displaySurroundingMines(), Tile.canOpen()
        Pre-condition:
        User clicked on a tile and needs corresponding tiles to open as well
        Post-condition:
        Tile is left opened with corresponding tiles opened as well

      • placeMines

        private void placeMines()
        calls setMine() the number of times equal to the number of mines
        See Also:
        setMine()
        Pre-condition:
        No guarantees are made before this function is called
        Post-condition:
        all mines are set into place

      • setMine

        private void setMine()
        sets a random x and y bound by the length of the rows and columns then checks if a mine is present, if a mine is present call setMine() again, eventually coming off the stack when all mines are placed.
        See Also:
        random
        Pre-condition:
        called number of mines times
        Post-condition:
        mine is set in a random tile

      • setRiskNum

        private void setRiskNum()
        checks the surrounding positions of a tile for a mine, if a mine is present increment mineRisk, once all if statements are checked called setSurroundingMines() and pass in mineRisk.
        See Also:
        Tile.getIsMine()
        Pre-condition:
        No guarantees are made before this function is called
        Post-condition:
        All of the tiles are given a mine risk number
